questions.question_text:
You need to add the custom domain names to Office 365 to support the planned changes as quickly as possible.
What should you create to verify the domain names successfully?

discussion.content: Answer is B See this resource: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/enterprise-users/domains-manage

comments.content: Yes, thank you. I thought the same thing then started questioning myself given the answer here.
I guess you're talking about a different question. The Azure AD custom domain is contoso.com

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Adatum.com is already verified so you dont need to verify 2 subdomains of Adatum domain... you need to verify only Humongous... domain. So I would go with B.

For me the option would be two TXT. One for the adatum.com, which is the parent domain, the subdomain will be include in the validation. And the second TXT would be for the humungus domain. 
The option is not there, other people are commenting dantum.com is already validated, so is either a different question they're talking about, or is a mistake of this question.

Selected Answer: B
Only the Humongous domain needs to be verified with a TXT-record

Selected Answer: B
I just checked and yes once a domain is validate the subdomains not need to be validate

comments.content: What you need for all three domains are CNAME records to configure autodiscover. A TXT record is only necessary for domain verification (and can be deleted after that has happened) and so is only necessary for the one non-verified domain.

To be clear: autodiscover (and the CNAME records connected to it) are NOT necessary for what the questions asks to perform, "to add the custom domain names to Office 365". For that one TXT record, for the Humongous domain, is enough.

discussion.content:
As the response to the answer is correct and assumes B the correct answer is still D.
The domain is verified due to the parent domain but you are still required to register 3 txt records.
As the question suggests the answer is D. The domain is verified is correct but you are still required to add the TXT records for the subdomains with your provider.

Selected Answer: B
Didn't get it at the first reading:

=> The network contains an Active Directory forest named contoso.com and a Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant named contoso.onmicrosoft.com.
You recently configured the forest to sync to the Azure AD tenant.

=> In other words, contoso.com is already been set up!

-=Planned Changes=-
Contoso plans to provide email addresses for all the users in the following domains:
East.adatum.com
Contoso.adatum.com
Humongousinsurance.com

=> contoso.com is already been set up, no changes are needed for the subdomains!

=> Humongousinsurance.com needs a TXT-Record => (B)

comments.content:
Keep on reading joergsi ;-)
"You recently configured the forest to sync to the Azure AD tenant." So contoso.com is setup.
"You add and then verify adatum.com as an additional domain name." This means adatum.com is also setup. So the subdomains for adatum.com don't need a TXT record.
humongousinsurrance.com is new and needs a TXT record => answer B
OK, need to correct me after reading this a third-time, contoso is not adatum!

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B one txt record, the subdomains are been verified from the top level domain
It is B: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38555474/do-i-need-to-register-a-domain-name-for-my-subdomain

The answer is B. From the domain FAQ question "Can I add custom subdomains or multiple domains to Microsoft 365?":
"When you add a subdomain, it is automatically verified based on the parent domain that is being verified."
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/setup/domains-faq?view=o365-worldwide
The supplied answer is wrong. Adatum.com has already been verified and so subdomains can be added without additional verification. The correct answer is B.

based on the text:
- Adatum.com is already verified 
- Humongousinsurance.com is not verified

I just tested and you can add sub-domains from exisiting Domains in Azure AD -> Custom domain names without any additional effort an they apear verified (here) right away. You can also create users with the subdomain. 

However, under Settings -> Domains the subdomain apears as incomplete and to need to add a TXT record for that to become healthy.

comments.content: but in the question, it isn't asked if there are healthy, so like PDB999 wrote "B" is right or ?

If you skip adding dns records you will have "no service selected". So subdomain is verified without txt record. Next you have to add MX, CNAME and TXT for SPF in order to assign services like mail - then your subdomain status will be "healtly" (but these records are for services to running correctly, not for verifying :)
so just 1 txt record for verifying new domain is needed

discussion.content:
Would it not be 'B': One TXT record?
East.adatum.com - this is a subdomain of adatum.com that would already be verified
Contoso.adatum.com - this is a subdomain of adatum.com that would already be verified
Humongousinsurance.com - this is a new domain that would need verifying via a TXT record

Correct, D.

You can use a TXT record to verify your domain. Select this and select Next to see instructions for how to add this DNS record to your registrar's website. This can take up to 30 minutes to verify after you've added the record.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to meet the application requirements for the Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise applications.
You create an XML file that contains the following settings.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1:
Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise feature updates will be installed twice a year in March and September.
The Channel element in the configuration file is set to 'Targeted'. This means Semi-Annual Targeted.
To help your organization prepare for a Semi-Annual Channel release, Microsoft provides Semi-Annual Channel (Targeted). The primary purpose of this update channel is to give pilot users and application compatibility testers in your organization a chance to work with the upcoming Semi-Annual Channel release
Box 2:
âœ‘ Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise applications must be installed from a network share only.
The AllowCDNFallback value is currently set to true. The purpose of this setting is to enable Office 365 to be downloaded from Microsoft's Content Delivery
Network if the network share is unavailable. The AllowCDNFallback value should be set to false to meet the technical requirement.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/configuration-options-for-the-office-2016-deployment-tool#updates-element https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-of-update-channels-for-office-365-proplus

discussion.content: Correct - In exam 2023-02-02
Correct answers given. Setting the AllowCdnFallback toFalse makes sure the (language) files/packages won't be downloaded over the Office Content Delivery Network (CDN).

choices.B: From Exchange Online PowerShell, run the New-MailboxExportRequest cmdlet.
choices.C: From Exchange admin center, start the migration and select Remote move migration.
choices.D: From the Exchange admin center, start the migration and select Cutover migration.
choices.A: From Exchange Online PowerShell, run the New-MailboxImportRequest cmdlet.

questions.question_text: Which migration solution should you recommend for Project1?

comments.content: This is a better link to back up answer C: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/hybrid-deployment/move-mailboxes

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Anser C is correct.
This is a hybrid setup senario where sales department will be moved to exchange online and ohter departments will stay on-prem. For Hybrid setup, the correct answer is "remove move migration". Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/exchange-server/exchange-150/jj945412(v=exchg.150)?redirectedfrom=MSDN#:~:text=A%20remote%20move%20migration%20is%20used%20to%20migrate%20on%2Dpremises%20Exchange%20mailboxes%20to%20Exchange%20Online%20in%20an%20Exchange%20hybrid%20deployment.%20You%20must%20have%20an%20Exchange%20hybrid%20deployment%20to%20use%20a%20remote%20move%20migration
Correct

Selected Answer: C
Ill go with this answer

Selected Answer: C
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/hybrid-deployment/move-mailboxes
You can use the remote move migration wizard in the EAC in the on-premises Exchange organization to move existing user mailboxes from on-premises Exchange to Exchange Online:
1. In the EAC, go to Office 365 > Recipients > Migration.
2. Click Add +, and then select Migrate to Exchange Online.
3. On the Select a migration type page, select Remote move migration and then click Next.

Selected Answer: D
A. From Exchange Online PowerShell, run the New-MailboxImportRequest cmdlet.
NO.This cmdlet is available only in on-premises Exchange. (THE SAME QUESTION)
B. From Exchange Online PowerShell, run the New-MailboxExportRequest cmdlet.
NO.This cmdlet is available only in on-premises Exchange. (THE SAME QUESTION)
 
C. From Exchange admin center, start the migration and select Remote move migration.
NO.The Mailbox Replication Service (MRS) has a proxy endpoint that's required for cross-forest mailbox moves and remote move migrations between your on-premises
D. From the Exchange admin center, start the migration and select Cutover migration.

choices.D: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, start a data migration and click Upload PST as the data service.
choices.A: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, start a data migration and click Exchange as the data service.
choices.B: From the Exchange admin center, start a migration and select Cutover migration.
choices.C: From the Exchange admin center, start a migration and select Staged migration.

questions.question_text: Which migration solution should you recommend for Project1?

discussion.content: -From The Exchange admin center, start Migration and select staged migration

Selected Answer: A
Ill go with this answer

Selected Answer: A
Would go towards A but it's really hard to make a decision here.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/mailbox-migration/decide-on-a-migration-path

'Fewer than 150 Slowly, by migrating a few users at a time. Exchange Hybrid'

Selected Answer: A

https://www.nucleustechnologies.com/blog/exchange-server-2016-hybrid-migration-to-office-365/

Selected Answer: D
Export and import PST is the correct solution in this scenario.

comments.content: Sorry, Exchange as Data Service is the correct answer as the On-premises Exchange is exchange 2016

discussion.content: I dont think cutover will sove the problem. Becouse we are only migrateing 1 Department and the otherones nees to stay onprem

Selected Answer: B
A. From the Microsoft 365 admin center, start a data migration and click Exchange as the data service.
 Yes, then apply option B
B. From the Exchange admin center, start a migration and select Cutover migration.
Yes, Choosing a cutover migration is suggested when: Your current on-premises Exchange organization is Microsoft Exchange Server 2003 or later. Your on-premises Exchange organization has fewer than 2,000 mailboxes
C. From the Exchange admin center, start a migration and select Staged migration.
No,A staged migration is recommended when: Your source email system is Microsoft Exchange Server 2003 or Microsoft Exchange Server 2007, or you have more than 2,000 mailboxes
D. From the Microsoft 365 ad

In the EAC, go to Office 365 > Recipients > Migration.

Click Add Add Icon., and then select Migrate to Exchange Online.

On the Select a migration type page, select Remote move migration and then click Next.

On the Select the users page, click Add Add Icon. and select the on-premises users to move to Microsoft 365 or Office 365 and click Add and then click OK. Click Next.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/hybrid-deployment/move-mailboxes
BTW when you go to M365 and Set up and migration there is an option to select exchange as a data service

So Remote Move ist the way to go but I dont find this:
 From the Microsoft 365 admin center, start a data migration and click Exchange as the data service.

From the Microsoft 365 admin center, start a data migration and click Exchange as the data service - This doesnt exists! 

Microsoft 365 Admin Centre > Setup > Migrations > Email> Get Started > Import my PST files - this should be the Answer

I misread the question: It's not selecting the Cutover answer but Remote Move (as indicated by picking a migration source -- that's part of a remote move because you have to indicate whether you're going from cloud to on-prem or on-prem to cloud). That's a good choice and you can select the users to migrate using a remote move. Staged migration is only available on 2007 and 2010. My bad.

The discussion in the "Show Solution" is great but the provided answer (Cutover) is wrong. You should use Cutover only when moving all the mailboxes (up to 2000 but 150 is the recommended target): https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/mailbox-migration/cutover-migration-to-office-365.
If you're moving some (not all) of your mailboxes, which is what this question asks, you want to do a staged migration by providing a list of users to migrate in a CSV file: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/mailbox-migration/perform-a-staged-migration/perform-a-staged-migration

comments.content:
Staged Migration is only application for Windows Server 2003 and 2007 https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/mailbox-migration/what-to-know-about-a-staged-migration#:~:text=As%20part%20of%20a%20Microsoft,it's%20called%20a%20staged%20migration.&text=Consider%20using%20a%20cutover%20migration%20or%20a%20hybrid%20email%20migration%20instead.

Answer A doesnt make sense as the solution doesnt exist, so it has to be D!

discussion.content:
The first answer is wrong:
1. Organization information: https://admin.microsoft.com/ --> Settings --> Org Settings --> Organization information --> Techincal contact
2. Release preferences
Tested and confirmed - Correct answers are: Organization Information & Release Preferences

- organization Information 
- Release preference
I also believe it's Org Settings & Release Prefs
Briefing emails do not provide information with service status notifications. It should be service health.
